A nice concept with poor execution. If you like RTS games, you will quickly find that the game's control are extremely clunky. For instance, setting up a simple two-step move (aka waypoint) requires to press and hold the shift key before even the first move order. Another example, once your units are on top of walls, they will refuse to go down them if there is even ONE non-walled unit in your selection group. This forces you to either select the wall segments one-by-one, or double clic to select them all and risk giving orders to more than the intended group. Combine that with a fairly slow pace, and it turns out to be a waste of time in my opinion.
ONE OF THE BEST REAL TIME STRATEGY SO FAR

Very nice take on the genre and some quite epic battles in the end of the (for now) short campaign. I really like the proper "build a castle and defend it" game-play you get with large hordes of enemies assailing the walls. Good difficulty, perhaps even a little bit too hard if you decide to be a nice guy at the second mission. Have replayed that one mission many times before passing. Hope to see more missions, and perhaps a longer or more varied economy for longer game plays.

Diplomacy is NOT an Option is a castle defense/build real-time strategy where you are the King of a kingdom and you are defending against smelly, obnoxius, unwashed/dirty, nasty, pox-ridden scum-that-they-are, illiterate and uncultured buffoons. superstitious, and foolish peasants who've had it with your shenanigans (presumably because you have had taxed the ever-livin' F*CK out of them - or, perhaps, you take advantage of prima nocta and sleep with their women and got them with child - and the serfs then rebel. WHATEVER the case may be. It is good to be King!). LONG LIVE THE EMPIRE! Down with REBEL scum! <Ahem> Oops, wrong setting... You can play either the campaign (in which there is 2 or 3 missions at present), or endless mode. In either case, you have to build up your kingdom while maintaining your resources and food, and building up your army. DO NOT UNDERESTIMATE your angry villagers. Know what a Zerg is? You haven't seen ZERGING until you see masses of angry, pitchfork wielding scum coming at you like a living, moving carpet. YOU WILL BE STOMPED if you don't treat them seriously! Try the demo to see if you like it before buying. The game could be a Stronghold killer but this game isn't fully complete in the missions yet. DINAO is actully like Age of Darkness or They Are Billions in similarity. Build houses to increase your population while balancing food intake/outake; acquire different types of soldiers, have gravedigger houses that will bury your dead (if you don't, they rise into an enemy unit), watch out for plague, erect defensive walls and towers, and more. And this game is fun on endless. It can be punishing and brutal. But then again I've heard of some players saying it's too easy even on brutal settings.
I tried it, wasn't my kind of game, I liked it, dont get me wrong, but i didnt see myself enjoying it long term. So i refunded this item. I recommend it for others to try.

This game fills that long-sought niche for me; a blend of city management and excessive violence. As of now the game lacks depth, but it's an extremely solid concept I sunk 12 hours into so far, it lets me relive my Total War: Rome days where instead of enslaving tens of thousands of dirty peasants, I can nail them into the ground with crossbows, splatter them with Trebuchets, or bonk with squads of burly Hammer Guys. A lot of fun.

Solid Game overall. Much replay ability. Being "Early Release" the campaign is very short and not completed. However it is enough to teach you the game mechanics and suffice as a tutorial. I am sure it will be complete when game is final. Overall the game is solid and gives up what it states it does. This is Age of Empires meets They Are Billions and in a very good way. Worth the meager 20 bucks for sure. Had zero issues running it and the game performed well overall. The mechanics are solid and units well done for there roles.

I'm hoping for more updates in the future but for me it has already been worth the purchase. I really like this game

Fun game and I'm looking forward to the full release, definitely going to spend some hours on this! It's a great defense type game that let's you take to the field as well, you'll look up and wonder where the time went. On the other side of things, there are some stability issues once the spawns balloon. Pacing is a little wonky, they overwhelm you quickly, then once you get into a longer game it becomes a bit better as you get to use the tech tree, just doesn't happen every game. Tech tree is a little limited, but makes sense if the gametime is meant to be shorter. As a note, only 2 campaign missions are out, but the pacing issues above might clear up once the rest of it's out as you can really only play endless mode right now. TL:DR Looking forward to this game's full release as it's right up my alley for defense games.

I can't believe this game is still in Early Access, it's just too good!! Diplomacy is Not an Option is very hard, to the point of being brutal. One mistake and you're dead. The game might be a bit too hard/unbalanced for now but it's still a joy to play after 33 hours. (I'm still on mission 2, help!) You have to balance a flawless economy and a perfect military force to ensure your castle survives to the stronger and stronger waves coming at you. You left some corpses of yours into an expedition and you think it's fine? Well if you don't build enough gravediggers in a sufficient time, watch your dead soldiers returning as zombies to take your crown once their bodies rot, the same rotten bodies making your villagers sick and transmitting the disease to each other leading to an epidemic. You have built enough dravediggers? Well now you have to protect the graveyard because if the latter is destroyed, the same amount of zombies spawn and add themselves to the mass of rebelling peasants. But zombies aren't the only problem, as there's gravity taken into account, economic issues, starvation droughts as you have to manage the hunger of your citizens along with the influx of population coming every day. I haven't tried yet the endless mode because my laptop is limited but I can't wait for new missions to come out, and the map is absolutely big! This game is truly a gem, and it's bound to become better with time.

Hmmm...the game seems extremely unbalanced. I'm playing the second campaign, and the onslaught at the end is just out of control. The amount of "limited" workers or citizens to become soldiers is crazy low. One soldier dies and you can't replace them until the day cycles. WTF? Ever played one of these games before? I played the tutorial, and no help there. I'll keep trying to figure this out, but for "a walk in the park" it's more like a gang rape at the end of the second mission. There shouldn't be a near death moment at that level until half a dozen games in. I would dial this WAY back for beginners, or make an even easier level for people trying to learn the mechanics.

I enjoy this game a lot and am very excited for future updates. At its current state, it is a pretty hefty challenge in the campaign missions but that isn't exactly a terrible thing. This combines the gameplay mechanics of other base survival games but with an art style that is very nice to look at. The comedic elements present in the game, chiefly the "story" cut scenes are much appreciated and work at making sure its not just a soulless tower defense game. I'm very intrigued with the prospect of a branching story mode that may change based on your decisions- such as choosing to support your lord or the rebelling faction. I find myself checking every other day for updates just so I can jump back in and play another 10+ hours. In short, good game and I can't wait for what the final product will look like.
Worth it!

Save your money. This game keeps crashing at later stages of the game. Not to mention fps drops to 15fps on later enemy waves (not a potato pc) I managed to get to day 58 on hardest difficulty on endless. 80k kills. Had a crash almost every day since day 38, and the only reason I lost on 58 is because I got bored of micromanaging my towers to target hundreds of enemy siege 1 by 1. Can't even shift click on enemy... Never managed to get so many enemies on the map as it's being advertised on the screenshots. Zombies seem to be allied with the raiders... Prepare to micro-micromanage your every tower to target enemy siege weapons. Why isn't is a setting? You have one for targeting nearest and strongest enemy. Prepare to trade 150-300 resources for 7-30 gold every 2 minutes. Prepare to get frustrated with your citizens getting stuck on each other or corners of buildings. If you liked They Are Billions and like medieval setting you will like this, that is until you run into all those issues I mentioned above. There were a few other issues I had but can't remember them now. Skip this for now until it gets more polish and fixes or buy when on sale for 50%. 4/10 right now but has the potential to be an 8/10. Might come back in a year or two to see how the game's going.

the whole point of this game is to survive wave after wave of enemy attacks, each wave gets larger and larger. on the surface it is a great idea and is fun...right up until the game engine cant handle the amount of enemy it is sending at you. it is NOT a hardware issue it is the game software itself that cannot even handle what it is designed to do. so the game will ALWAYS crash no matter what. the game itself cannot handle the ever increasing enemy waves which makes the game useless and unplayable. the dev's cannot simply fix this, they would have to scrap it and start over which they wont. they will simply release a completely flawed game. if you want several hours of fun followed by hours of anger and frustration over game crashes, than this is the game for you.

So far so great! 8 hours in and it an enjoyable game. Kind of what I wish we could get on some of these Mobile Games! I have only had one issue which made the game freeze but I just assumed I was doing way to many things at once. Can’t wait for full release!

Awesome game. Perfect mix of thought and somewhat mindless play. Watching hordes of foes get mowed down by concentrated crossfire is great. Later waves do lock up the game currently, once you break day 120 to 150 I have noticed more frequent crashing but that is to be expected in early access games. I do hope to see more features in later updates. What would make this even better? Easier deployment of troops to walls currently players have to individually place archers on the walls, a group deployment would be great. As far as new features, LADDERS SIEGE TOWERS, RAMS, BOILING OIL, MURDER HOLES would take this to the next level. Lets get to a place where we place melee troops on the walls to repel invaders hand to hand...lets add MOATS, TRAPS. Combat on the walls, maybe give attackers the option to MINE beneath the walls... IDK if the designer looks at these comments, I hope so because this is a blast overall. New way to play.... let players take the role of attacker and assault AI designed fortresses... the goal? Take the fort in as few waves as possible... Just some ideas that I think would really expand replay value and could make a really awesome multi player option.... anyway, great game overall, I cant wait to see what future updates bring.

i dont know why people are complaining about the difficulty so much.I played the game around the beta release and enjoyed it big time back then. hardest difficulty level was ultra hardcore and on the last mission ( i think it was 3rd level) it took me around 30 hrs to beat it. i had a pretty good understanding of the game by the time i beat it and it felt nice. didnt touch the game after that until the full release now. compared to that time the your worst nightmare difficulty setting is a lot more manageable ( there is auto market now) and it is 100% easier. first few waves are definitely tweaked to have less enemies and there are big areas in the map with choke points on the sides. if you are having problems just follow the steps: on the start full lumberjacks after you are outta ppl then do houses until day 2, do a couple of builder houses,research speed for builders, build stone cutter and food ( some more lumber jacks are nice ) barracks and houses if you can,day 3 build the barracks if you couldnt on the 2nd day upgrade town hall then barracks from this point you do crossbow + axe man or spearman ( based on your map and resources ) and the game should be easy from this point on, some times you have to make the builder for laser thingy on the 1st wave wich is super op early game. and for the late game do multiple towers in a row ( 1st crossbow then ballista with the strongest enemy attack prio cuz of the enemy siege weapons and after that Trebuchet

Just annoying...it does not tell you how much food you need (just how much food you are using) so you do not realize you are running out until it is too late and then you are screwed...once your storage places are filled you cannot rid yourself of unneeded material so you can get more (so if you are short wood and have tons of stone and you need wood you are screwed)...if you are short of workers and you reduce your army to get workers the former army do NOT become soldiers...the idea behind the game is good, but too many limitations making playing frustratingly annoying...no guides on, 'how to avoid running out of food', 'how to avoid running out of workers'...I place a ton of berry bushes and fishing huts all over the map and still am short of food...

After 24 hours of playing this game, I have to say I am already a fan. Plenty of reviews calling it a mix of Tower defence and Age of Empires, and that's exactly what you're getting, and its fabulously addicting. Maybe my review won't get read or noticed but I have to clear the air with some criticism and suggestions in hopes of improving the game. (I KNOW it is Early Access, and that's precisely why I am about to state the following) Negatives ( at the moment of writing): - Crashes during later waves... right now that's a game killer, after the amount of hours you put into building your defences for a crash to happen over and over on the same wave, even after saving... quite frustrating. - Resources deplete too fast, makes it too hard for you to plan scaling your base. Suggestions for improvements: - Options to improve resource depletion efficiency during late game ( as there is forester for wood, and farms for food), or regeneration of stone and iron deposits. - An option to select and move multiple units which are in towers, and an ability to move units from tower to tower directly. - An option to upgrade weaker units into stronger ones directly, instead of dismissing and recruiting new ones, and maybe later branching of unit upgrades into different specialisations. - An option to deactivate the ''hold attack'' stance on units without needing to move them. - The presence of a game encyclopedia with information about foe types, weaknesses, strengths. - Other means of obtaining gold, such as maybe sparse gold mines to be extracted by respective gold collection building type. - Perhaps, an ability to promote units after a certain number of kills by the unit, which may come with stat and/or cosmetic enhancements. - Co-op mode ? Build together with a friend and protect against the waves, exchange materials, plan out base building, sounds fun to me at least. - I have heard this one on multiple other reviews so I guess I'll support it here as well... more magic related units, you know the usual fire for burning, ice for slowing...blah blah...

Pros: An excellent sandbox game with optimal graphic and system intensity, with a touch of tower defense mechanic. Cons: Game would freeze / crash after raids, limited market functions (eg. I have 6000 excess of woods but the max trading cap is always 300). Suggestions: 1. Optimize the market functionality. 2. Need bigger maps, or even better with map editor with playing options eg. Endless natural resource mode, enemy type, exploration / invasion. 3. More research and development.

The game is good, however there are a few problems that I hope will be fixed in time. The way in which you can define the action zones of certain buildings (e.g. gatherers or lumberjacks) needs to be improved. For example, instead of choosing the centre of the zone and then frantically clicking on the button to enlarge/shrink the zone, it would be more practical to simply right-click and drag. In the same way the AI of the builders should be improved or allow to have an efficient way to micromanage them, for example allow buildings to have the same building priority and let the AI choose which builder goes on which building in order to minimize unnecessary moves. We should be able to put the market in automatic mode, we define which resource we want to sell and against what, and each time the airship comes back it leaves as soon. Or else to have a queue of trades to do that are done automatically each time the airship comes back. The AI of catapults and trebuchets should also be improved, when it is set to "attack the nearest enemy" it should nevertheless make it possible to type in a way to take maximum advantage of zone damage. Similarly when it comes to targeting the strongest enemies, the name is ambiguous and it should be possible to choose exactly what type of enemy to target first. Also it should be possible to remove several buildings at once, possibly with a confirmation popup. We should also be able to garrison a whole wall with archers at once instead of having to garrison them one by one, it's so annoying that I've given up on the idea of placing archers on it.

This game is very addicting and fun to play. It keeps you on your toes at all times. Very fast paced with no room for mistakes. It keeps you thinking all of the time. There are a few things that I wish were better like more buildings and a way to farm/produce soul crystals as well as an improvement to the market system. At some point you exhaust all of the maps resources and the market just is not fast enough to keep up with your resource demand. Either expand the ability and capacity of the market place or allow multiple market places to be built. An auto trade feature would also be great. Apart from that I absolutely love this game. Major props to the development team. I am very excited to see what else they have in store for us!

This is a hopeful title so don't be scared of wasting money, I look forward to it's advancements in the future, who knows, maybe I'll even try the campaign then. 10/10 for potential 10/10 for difficulty 5/10 for graphics (definitely not something i care too much about) 10/10 for making me remember the nostalgia of age of empires, kingdoms, age of mythology, empire earth, and the other classic rts games

If you're after a casual-moderately challenging game this isn't really it. This is a frustratingly hard builder with waves that come far more quickly than I'd like, with limited resource sites you'll always be struggling to make resources meet. It's got a huge amount of potential, but it's just frustratingly, nail bitingly difficulty where the game just won't ease off. Not a game you can switch off playing, and for me, that's a problem as I come home after work to play games to relax.

Fun game, hits that fine line between wanting to play an APM intensive RTS and wanting to sit back and watch your armies go nuts. Multiplayer either via coop or pvp would be amazing, and I wish that I had some means of expansion for when the random seed sets all of the stone/iron far away, but plenty of time for QOL additions. As a few others have mentioned though, very little campaign content which is a bummer. There were 2(.5) missions available, and I'm not sure what kept them from adding more, as even those missions seemed to be procedurally generated. I also found myself a little irritated with having to quash the locals before the final wave instead of being able to build up an impressive grand army/defensive perimeter. It's most certainly doable, but the gap in difficulty was ridiculous, it felt that you very much HAD to clear the map or risk being overwhelmed. Overall a fun game, don't know if I feel it's worth the 25$ price tag right now, but if they add the content that it looks like they've prepared for, and implement some multiplayer functions this will be an awesome game to play with some friends or solo for fans of RTS!

I really like this game! Reminds me of an updated version of Firefly Studio's Stronghold which I absolutely loved back in the day. I also get strong Banished vibes, only this is better because it has a combat mechanic where the former did not. Positives: + Cool graphical style. Works well for this type of game. + Fun and addicting gameplay. I've already sunk 9 hours into this and I always look forward to playing more. + Good variety of buildings and units. + Interesting tech tree with lots of options. It's difficult to choose which research to go with, but that's how it should be. Negatives: - Difficulty is a little unbalanced. You can make it easier by choosing the easiest difficulty, but where's the fun in that? Also, your choices in the game affect how difficult it is. Want to side with the people and fight the monach? Yeah, it's going to be harder than siding with the king and fight peasants. - Not a ton of content at the moment, but it is in early access, so that's to be expected. Thankfully, you get a lot of mileage out of the content that is there. Looking forward to upcoming updates. Well worth the $25 entry fee. I've paid way more for way less game. If you're an RTS fan, this is a no brainer. Just be ready to play the same levels over and over again until you figure out the winning strategy.

Amazing game, love the combat system, love the difficulty. Game is still in early access so some features don't feel flushed out yet (mainly the campaign) but it has a lot of potential. Definitely worth the price even in its current state. Just waiting for the campaign to become fully playable.

Cool game with nice humor. If you liked the old stronghold games and/or horde-survival games it is great. The only downsides atm (March 2022) are missing content (in the campaign) and a polish in balancing. But since this is still WIP and early access that's fine. Looking forward to more missions.
its like "They are billions" but with a more cartoonish feel to it...still a wonderful game and challenging too!

Played for a little while now and honestly, its a lot of fun and would easily be addicting. The main reason I say "would" is because sadly for me it did continuously crash. I played for about 4 hours and it crashed 3 times. Although the time inbetween the crashes was super fun and really cool and im enjoying the look of it too. For now ill give it a 6.5/10 because it cant be played thoroughly through a whole gaming session but once its fixed up and gets more updates ill definately take it up to an 8.5/10 cause it really is fun and pleasing to the eyes. Great work please continue to work on it!

Great strategy game! It's crashed on me a couple of times, but outside of that it's a solid game!

I adore this game and how hard it can be with the wrong generation but the mid-game can be a little tough. I would like to see a sandbox mode and a custom map generator. But overall great game but needs to have some good updates to keep me in

Tons of fun! Endless! :D

Amazing game! Reminds me a lot of 'They are Billions' but much better. The upgrading and building of defense towers/weapons is much faster and you're not sitting around for long periods of time waiting to mine enough wood/iron/stone to build your next structure. 8/10 the game could use more blood and gore, personal preference.
great unique experience!

Fantastic game! Well built and plays very well! If you are a fan of games like StarCraft or base defense games in general, you should really enjoy this one! Many of the mechanics we already know are well executed and the controls are very similar, so learning is very easy. There's not much to complain about, but I do want to point out some balance issues that I found to reduce the flow of the game for me. In the beginning of the rounds, base building has a great balance between resource gathering and construction. It's very easy to develop a flow and balance everything you need to advance. However, there's a point where you have to build a "Market" that is designed to somehow generate a new resource (by that point), a gold coin. This coin is a requirement to upgrade buildings and certain units. I unfortunately couldn't get this to work, even when trading for resources that I didn't need. The ability to trade for resources only becomes valuable when you get a map that doesn't spawn a specific resource within your starting area... I assume. This rarely happens however, so this building becomes extremely pointless for me and forced my strategy to successfully function without it. Maybe it's a glitch or something I was doing wrong, but after ten trades in one round, I was unable to generate one single coin. So I found that you can just create an old "Zerg" defense setup to overcome the lack of upgrades allowed by this building. I have beat the couple rounds that the game currently has, but I am a little frustrated that I haven't been able to see or try ANY of the buildings or units that require these coins. With all that being said, I still think it's a great game! With it still being in development, I'm sure we'll see some adjustments/fixes that will make things like this much better. This game has some great potential and is a great addition to the genre! With the fun humor, well balanced difficulty, and attention to quality, this game goes high on my recommendation list. Can't wait to see what else this title has to bring!
it's pretty fun. Solid mix of city building, strategy, and tower defense.

Yeah will do. Could do with assorted tower options or more diverse troops. Economy is slow as and takes forever to get going as its linked to food and population etc... Can frustrate and become one dimensional fast. Maybe when the Campaign goes past stage 2 and is launched it will have more grunt. A Casual time waster at the moment!

Not going to lie, I love RTS games and I thought I was ready for this one. Nope almost died on the first level on normal mode. The story is hilarious and interesting for an EA game. Not to mention the balance of city builder and wave defense is so, so nerve racking. Love it.
very nice

Awesome game so far, can't wait for the rest of the campaign to come out! Had a thought about the market place, would it be possible to add like a auto trade function where the player can choose what material to sell/gain and the zeppelin just keeps doing it by itself? Just on the endless mode, the only really thing to keep going back to is the trading for resources. Perhaps adding some sort of adjustable threshold too (i.e once wood drops below 5k the auto trading will stop and the player will be informed). Just a thought though! Once again, also game, love the game play, the music and everything about it, keep up the great work!!

Early Access review: There's only 2 missions and Endless Mode has 4 levels from 0-ALL the enemies. They say the rest of the campaign will come on release. I had fun for 4 hours on the first 2 missions though, might try the endless mode now. Game is basically They are Billions but in a fantasy setting, there's all the medieval shenanigans you expect + a fair smattering of magic thrown in for good measure. The plot is silly, expect many dad jokes on full release.

I had 20 free workers that I could make into soldiers to combat 200 enemies? (THANK GOD FOR THE CATAPULT) This game has an insane difficulty spike and I'm playing on the easiest difficulty of the first campaign mission... they came and absolutely destroyed my base on wave 3/4? like what? 4/4 I decided I'm going to put this game on the shelf until it comes out of early access. Its still an early build with limited functions compared to other RTS titles but what it does have is more than enough to keep you very entertained for hours on end. Im looking forward to future updates and added content but I think this game would be even better if they added a multiplayer function like AOE. Overall great game but don't expect perfection just yet.

Game is fun, but very very alpha. After 6 hours I had myself in a place where I don't think the attackers could ever get through. Walls 5 layers deep covered with archers and backed up with trebuchets every few spaces. The iron and stone deplete rapidly and then you just create excess food or lumber to buy stone and iron... that would find, but you can only have a single market. Beyond all that, even with the simple graphics once I got to day ~200 the game crashes. Too many attackers rendering at once. I deleted scout towers to try and have fewer render at once, but it didn't work. Again, fun game, but still needs alot of work. Not worth $25 IMO

The campaign is only 2 missions. Endless mode isn't "endless" because resources are finite and you can't build forever. Unlike games such as They Are Billions, the resources run out. I'm not sure if that will be something added in the future but I can't recommend this currently, definitely not at the price point. The game is not near completion. Just wait until then.

This a potential game which is interesting. Have finished all three missions in hard-core mode. Randomly generated terrain gives possibilities - to boom or to build defenses. You never know in which position will the enemies come from. The huge horde is much easier because you know where will it come from and wall the place. But the sporadic raid is unpredictable. Many times I was just cleaning the surroundings when 4 knights suddenly comes from no where and killed tons of villagers. Even I have made watch towers and saw them coming, but when I saw them, it is already too late. I think the king's story line should be difference from the Bloody Scott's line. Peasant's wave maybe sporadic, unorganized and huge numbered. But the king's army is well-trained. They have formations, discipline, tactics. The endless mode, however, is just CPU burning. Watching trebuchet and the nuclear weapon shelling the peasants into the sky is a relief of stress. But when your FPS decreaseed you feel stress again. Even computer with GPU 3060 and CPU i7-11800H crashed at the 40th days horde. It is understandable that millions of enemies are generated together and each of them has a independent AI control. Just like 7dtd A20's horde, my suggestion is strengthen the peasants but reduce the number. Other way, maybe ask NASA if they have a spare computer. Also, if this game just keeps defending yourself and always starts with one TC and several villagers, it will become boring soon. Perhaps learning from campaign mode in Age Of Empires. Such as, you completed a side mission, you get rewarded and the next wave will become easier. Or just start with a huge amount of armies who are far from home and don't have enough supplies. No TC, no villagers, and supposed to capture the city in 7 days. Or your ally is in danger, when we arrived we found it is a trap and so on. Anyway, looking forward to the co-operate mode and the full-launch version. Maybe PvP mode is also considerable.

really fun RTS with similar mechanics to starcraft or age of empires, but is probably too difficult for most noobs in the genre to get far in the campaign. With some updates this should be perfectly fixable however so still worth checking out.

Super fun game. Usually, the games in this genre are overcomplicated and overwhelming. Not in this case. Rich variety of units and buildings, but you can easily understand their purpose, how do they work and etc. UI is also good, which is a rare thing again. Also, when I select one unit by clicking on it once, the game often decides to highlight every unit of it's type on my screen instead (as if I double-clicked.) Honestly this is a fifty-fifty Yes or No. Some people on steam clearly LOVE to bitch about Early Access games. This game is fun, however for my enjoyment it's fairly unbalanced even on 'relaxed' mode. Some suggestions I'd like to see are; a reward/reputation (Kudos and Kerdea) for surviving waves, longer down-time between waves. For too long I have downloaded nostalgic games and only found a gem here and there when I have looked on steam. This is the full treasure chest. No game on the the market can compare to this other than possibly "they are billions" but not close enough. From the demo I was hooked, the game play mechanics for even a portion of this game makes it playable and re-playable for hours on end. As all of the other reviews say, this game is in early access. But it has a fully fleshed and helpful tech tree, tons of economy and resource management, and play on 3x speed at your peril! Things for improvement at this stage (The game is completely playable and enjoyable in its current state) The campaign has a nice story line, although possibly add parts where there are reinforcements or where you can alternatively play as the peasants? Also an "attack move" option would be a godsend, as well as unit-grouping abilities, and queuing of multiple research projects. With research, perhaps the final tech could serve as a Civ "future tech" and allow you to improve efficiency when playing an endless mode. Additionally the resources are plentiful in the endless mode, but perhaps a tech would be something similar to Tropico where you can extract deeper deposits or have deep seam mines etc. for longer playthroughs. All in all, I paid 25 dollars for an easily 60 dollar game and have had nothing but enjoyment. And the easy mode is so manageable; but not without challenge, great job developers.

I'd like to categorize my review as "Recommended with a couple of small caveats." First, the good parts: The biggest plus of this game is that it is addictingly fun. I usually wait a while after wishlisting a game, but I had such a blast with the demo that I decided to buy this at full price, and definitely feel I've gotten my money's worth in enjoyment. This game is challenging, but in my opinion does a good job of making it "challenging but fun" as opposed to "infuriatingly difficult" - when I get overrun, I don't want to ragequit, but try again and see if I can do better. It also has a nice art style, and while the tutorial doesn't show everything you can do, I've found that it's not difficult to intuit how to play this game in terms of tactics, upgrades, etc. Now for the caveats: This is an early access game, and so the campaign mode currently only has two missions - the map indicates that there's a lot more planned, but a lookup in discussions indicates that the campaign mode will be fleshed out over the coming year. There is an endless mode to help keep you satiated before more missions are added, but do keep that in mind. Also, mileage may vary in terms of price - I feel I got my money's worth, but I can understand others being hesitant with the asking price. Also, there's still a couple of bugs. In my case, the game has been running pretty well, even though my PC is several years old and nowhere near the latest specs, but the campaign cutscenes are lacking visuals for me - just the audio and a black screen.
I really enjoyed this game, it has definitively more charm than your usual tower defense game. Looking forward for more missions.

Different terrains influencing the enemy for example , or special enemy units which focus on weakpoints and call the others to that point so you wanne have him dead like the torch guy in helms deep. Endgame economy is: Set up your woodfactory and farms(storage, foresters and lumberjacks) and be sure not to forget to trade other stuff for wood every 30 seconds. Good game, lets see how far the devs get in 6 months to a year.

But here they follow the given order and behave like you wanted. The game is easy to get into and you can grasp quite fast how you do what. interesting and fun game wrapped up in a nice package, but underwhelming in it's delivery. others do it better with more content for a similar or cheaper price. lots of visual bugs, difficulties that simply don't scale well, and procedurally generated randomized maps even on campaign levels mean RNG will screw you and waste an hour of your time. finite resources constantly force you to expand but you don't have the resources to keep expanding becase... the resources are finite and RNG based. the game is a constant rush and overall tedious as hell currently. the pacing is breakneck even on low difficulties and micromanaging every single building and worker is not fun especially when you end up with 100+ pretty rapidly. to put it simply, the concept and ideas are there but the implementation sucks ass. far too pricey for what you currently get, wait a few months and see what the devs do with it. 4/10

This game is essentially a clone of Stronghold with some features added. Between enemy waves you get to go and farm mobs with your army. In return you get some resources and mana points. The game has magic - you can summon troops or attack spells. You need to micro in early game because there are a lot of enemies and not many of your troops. Graphics are pretty nice if you are into this simplistic style. The hotkey scheme is pretty cool. Things to improve: The interface is a bit clunky - you have to remember where things are and it's not obvious. No control groups - why?? You can't control group units or buildings. Maybe I didn't figure it out, but if you need to figure out ctrl groups then something is wrong. Enemy AI is weird - they just go to the first unit that they agro on and then just keep chasing it. Good for kiting, Waves aren't done well. You don't know in advance where the waves will be coming from and you only get warning 2 minutes in advance. So you can't build proper defences in your first run of the mission. If that is done to inflate game time or just poor design I don't know, but it needs to be fixed. In Stronghold you see atack locations from the start of the mission - that is how it should be. Resource income is not shown in any obvious location - do I need more food gatherers? Do I need more wood cutters? Who knows. Waypoint placements don't work properly. It needs to work like in StarCraft 2. Loading and unloading of troops into towers doesn't work properly. Again - look how it works in SC2. Overall an OK game that needs some quality of life and AI improvements.

I want to preface by saying for anyone who was a childhood fan of age of empires 1-3, this will be right up your alley... in about a year or so when it has a reasonable degree of quality to warrant the fairly beefy price tag. Mechanically and visually it's all very tight but the dearth of content means it's a "hold off for a bit until there's a reasonable amount of content because it's just not there yet." 6/10
great game. add creative mode.

OK - first off, good job with the 3 levels - if you feel like a very casual building game closer to the old stronghold, this is the way to go. easy level gives you about 50-60 days before the waves become serious. middle level is very similar to the demo - challenging to get beyond 30-40 day (at least for a casual player) but it's very do-able. Impossible level is very unforgiving. I think it's probably great for twitchy fingered youth, but requires too much attention to detail for an old fart like me. Considering this is an independent title, I think they've done well and it's worthwhile to invest in this fun game even at alpha. I certainly look forward to where they will take it as the game moves forward!
Great game cant wait for more content

Why is this game so unpleasantly difficult? Playing in Endless mode the first wave is easy. The second wave is difficult and by the third wave it feels like having to manage as many food options as I can place and an army that's 1/4th the size of the enemy is just not doable for a casual player. The wooden walls feel absolutely worthless, they hold off the enemy for a solid 4 seconds and then any standing army is just wiped. Being forced to use spells to barely survive just doesn't add to the fun. Can we get a casual gamemode please? Because atm it's not fun, campaign or endless.

The game is comedic and facetious game that is challenging and fun to play. If you've played other RTS games, it uses the same basic mechanics while increasing the scale. I think the challenge comes from managing such large scale battles and kingdoms as things will occur that will hinder progress and will take attention away from battles. There is also the time management challenge of waves coming every few days and at first it is manageable but as the game goes on the army sizes increase exponentially. The art style is neat and helps keep the game light. During the campaign, you also get simple cinematics that are funny and make it worth beating the next level to see the next one. Great game and neat innovations on the RTS genre. I'm really looking forward to the full release!

LOVE this game. Reminds me of the good old days when I was a kid playing Impossible Creatures and Stronghold 2. But the devs don't try to hide the fact that it's on the way, and I can't wait for it! If you're gonna buy it before full release, maybe wait for a sale. But other than that, gameplay is incredibly addicting and I don't regret the purchase at all. Can't wait to see what direction this game takes.

I wouldn't recommend it at this point. It's alright but it has some big flaws. * You have to micro manage both the city as well as send out your army to defeat enemies around the map. It's not A way to play, it's the ONLY way to play. There aren't enough options for how to approach it it seems. * The difficulty is either too easy or brutally difficult and depends strongly on how well you micro managed your army and base. Playing the game at breakneck speed is a requirement. At this point I'd recommend just playing the original Stronghold and Stronghold Crusader, they do what this does but better in every way.

From that point of view it's good fun. Multi player would definitely add something to this, as would a more populated open world.

Marketplace needs a rethink in order to be able to scale up the amount of food (unlimited resource with farms) that you can trade for gold/iron etc - also need to be able to trade for gems for when you run out of camps to clear and no more gems
Still a work in progress but its getting there...
Only 2 missions, That it - is that i paid for? You better give me more content for this game
still getting updated and still enjoying, just buy it
fun

Game is enjoyable, but there are some selection and AI bugs that make micro managing really frustrating - Delayed box selection activation - auto double click selection - no are you sure on deletion, and hotkey is swapped with the key it usually is in other rts's This game is easier than the other similar games, except for the spacing in the hordes. They are much closer in this game leading to very unfair/frustrating outcomes. I did love the weird awkward cutscenes in campaign, can't wait for more of the campaign This game for some reason feels a bit more fun then the other ones. Not sure why, maybe because it feels like you can build a big army too potentially. I wish the research tree was big and more vast and more important Also it's not worth $25, in it's state I would say $10 maybe $15 if pushing it. In it's final state maybe 25

This game has a lot of potential, but it seems like there's not enough time between waves to get prepared even at the easiest setting. The waves just come too quickly to be able to build a big enough city or develop enough fortifications to do anything about them. By the final wave, you're just overwhelmed and have no real ability to fight back. That being said, the UI is great, the notifications about what's wrong and what you can do about it are great, the camera moves perfectly. It is a well-built game and it can be a lot of fun. It just seems like they made it way too hard for a casual gamer to pick up and feel like they're having any fun. They maybe need to tweak the timing of the waves to give a little more breathing room.

A really good RTS. I'm not sure if it is worth the price yet. But I'm having a great time with it. There are a few little things annoying things that I'm sure will be ironed out, and a few features that I would like to see added. Appart from that, I think there is great potential here.
it is okay for early access and has a lot of potential but it also needs to improve a lot for the final release

crashes past like wave 10 for no reason. even if you tell troops to guard, they end up just going where the hell they want anyway, mostly the siege engine does this. resource management late game is so boring, as you run out of everything except wood and end up just having to slowly buy all the things you need through the crappy exchange rate of wood. not a shabby game but would like to see some fixes an added content. as of now there is not a lot to do

This game is so fun!!! Please update with more content! I would recommend this game for anyone who's interested in RTS games Two things I wish this game can be improved. 1, In late game play, you will have unlimited woods and food due to the farm and tree planting. But stones and irons will run out very quickly and the only way to get more is to trade in the market. But only 1 market can be built. late game city expansion is drastically slowed down due to this issue. Please come up with more upgrade options for buildings to improve late game play. 2, this game does not utilize GPU and multi core processing very well. In late game massive battles, when the game starts to get laggy; my 16 core cpu is only under 25% load and 50% load for my GPU. I'm sure you guys can do so much better. Lastly, please give camera acceleration as it gets too slow to move around later in the game.
Great game! Keep adding more!
Can be difficult and frustrating but fun all the same

This game is great, only like 4 hours as im writing this but its difficult, and fun at the same time. I really like the endless mode, quite fun to just build and keep going until you get overwhelmed, Id ask for a mode without waves but it seems the dev team already is on that. good stuff
Most fun I've had in a while. I'm usually not the best at these types of games but even the easiest mode was a challenge. 10/10 would lose from famine again

Great Game, Simple and Challenging. You could spend loads of your time building your base in endless. Challenges:- To expand your troops while focusing on food & resource management. Insufficient Food will kill your troops, and if not handled quickly comes the pandemic. Remember to build your walls.
Great game and awsome endless mode. Currently finished wave 26 and are still going strong. Can't wait to see the future updates. Hopefully my pc wont explode before that time
brillant game my onlything i will have to say is make sure easy level is actually jeusus that level was hard but fun and rewarding
What Stronghold should have been. Atleast more like what Stronghold should have been.

So I've tried to play this game but the graphics just don't go low enough for my older laptop (around 5 years old but up to date windows) to even run the game at 15 fps. i really like the game from what I've seen on youtube and I'm hoping to be able to play when i get a better pc.

I cannot comment on the campaign but sandbox is fun . Game is very polished. I think this is as good or maybe better than TAB which is saying a lot. I like it better than Age of Darkness which is another TAB clone.
Awesome game
nice

This game has great potential - I love the art-style and the gameplay is already well thought out and engaging. Once you get the hang of it, you get to take on larger and larger groups of enemies. However, with a high amount of enemies - the core mechanic of the game only achieved after a few hours of playtime - the game crashes on every single wave. There is no crash report or means of communicating with the dev, which I would find critical releasing a game in such an unfinished state. The campaign is about 1 hour long and the endless mode always crashes. I've essentially reached the end of the endless-mode on day ~150, even on a very capable PC there are just too many enemies for the game to handle. I really hope the dev implements more features such as bug-reports to help iron out the crashing, then it would already be a great game. I'd also love to see the campaign completed, the map looks very promising with about 25 missions planned.

Another fine entry in the colony defense genre. The mechanics feel smooth for the most part for being an Early Access title, and while there are a few bugs and glitches, there's nothing game breaking. It's a good blend of city building, tower defense, and RTS. TLDR: It's very addicting, easy to learn, and hard to master.

Fun little game. Rather addictive. The performance is a bit meh, the procedurally generated maps can f*ck you early if your keep is in an awkward position and the cutscene dialogue could do with a bit of a rework, but I've played full priced AAA releases in a worse state than this. More than happy to support this project moving forward and I look forward to the updates.

Rarely do I bother reviewing games. You know how it is, the intent is often there but you don't feel compelled... and then comes DINAO. It's so addictive, can't wait to see what the devs do next. Awesome work on the early access version, it's so much fun and very challenging on the medium endless version (i'm 41yo so everything is challenging for me these days). Gameplay 10/10 (I'm playing endless mode) Graphics 8/10 Sound 8/10 Longevity (TBC, but looking good) Final words - If this takes on some of the 'Going Medieval' community building framework it will be epic. In many ways this is what I hoped Going Medieval would be. Kudos.

[h1]This is a great game! [/h1] [b]But the game is in its infancy[/b], and the game is seriously unbalanced!!! For the endless model, you can't get enough food, but you can't control the population. The huge population still won't bring enough idle people to build farms, so you can't produce enough food, which forms a vicious closed loop. In addition, the content of the game is too little, there are few things that can be built in the game, and there are not many types of soldiers that can be produced. Enemy units are usually only a large number, but most of them are miscellaneous soldiers, which reduces the gameplay.
Underrated game, pretty challenging but its very well made.

They fixed the stuff I wrote about. As far as I can tell this game is shaping up good. Below is original review. Has some really REALLY dumb design decisions. It's impossible to not have homeless people no matter how many houses you build. More people come each day. It's random which citizen gets kicked out of their house. If a military unit gets kicked out they INSTANTLY become a peasant and walk off the map forcing you to reload a save. This on top of several bugs makes what should be a fun game almost unplayable and frustrating. I want to like this game but unless they change such brain dead design choices I am tempted to refund it.

Love the game but unfortunately every time I get to around wave 20+ it crashes at the start or half way into the wave. Entire computer freezes and game crashes. Nothing to do with my computer or video card I have 10x the recommended requirements. GTX 2070 with 16GB Ram. I could play this for 100's of hours but the constant reloading is annoying. Also had to change the setting to save every 1 min otherwise I was always losing progress.

As long as the price stays under 30$ this is worth every penny. Gameplay is fun and addictive, Graphics are perfect for this genre with some neat attention to detail everywhere *1440p Ultra*. Unfortunately the games are cut short with small maps *on my second play through*, resources are to limited in my opinion and hope a true endless mode comes. A Coop feature would expand this game into its own genre *Pls add Coop <3*. Current state of the game 7.8/10
good game. needs more content.
been loveing it but for some reason its been crashing a lot! anyone else having this problem?

Great game, very well made and fun city builder and strategy game. I really like the art style, and there is a lot to this game. The only complaint I have is that in some areas the UI doesn't give you enough information. The info it tells you on the food producing buildings is confusing, and I don't see where it tells you total amount of food produced per day, just how much you are consuming per day. This makes it difficult to figure out how many food producing buildings you need to build, that's my only complaint. Edit: After about 8 additional hours of gameplay I want to come back and add to my review. My initial review was after only beating the first campaign mission. After playing some more, I managed to beat the second campaign mission on the medium difficulty, it was really hard and took many attempts. There are currently only 2 campaign missions and an endless mode, which I was disappointed to figure out. As others have stated, I feel like this game is a bit too difficult, and requires too much micromanagement. You have to stay as focused as possible the entire time you are playing to have even a chance at success, it is not a casual experience. I don't know if that's the Devs intent or not, but I'd prefer a more casual experience IMO. I wish their was a sandbox mode, I'd like to play around with more of the later game stuff without having to grind really hard to get to that point. I still do recommend the game as I think it'll be really good in the future, but do keep in mind right now it is early access so it has flaws.

The game overall just feels nice. You have points where you can just get into the game and forget time exists. The build cost of buildings seems pretty expensive for whatever you wanna build. The enemy waves scale very hard.
Great Game for sure! i am excited to see what more is to come
great game and very entertaining if you like tactics and learning about how best to go about your defence. However it can be frustrating when a zombie destroys half your houses!

such a fun game! second mission of the game actually posed quite a challenge I am excited to see how the rest of the campaign turns out. i think the only thing that's missing is variety in units and some improvements to the ai coordination and navigation. To elaborate i find that ranged units if set to attack an enemy through a wall will attempt to walk around instead of getting closer to the wall to shoot over, this can cause some frustration especially when you are fighting against waves of enemies coming in all directions . Are you a shut-in who builds walls to keep others out? Do you feel the rabble outside is overdue for a new [strike]plague[/strike] purge? Then this is the game for you. Build that ivory tower, count gold, and plow the gray masses under to fertilize your soil.

I understand that this is still in early access, and I do believe this will be a great game; however it currently isn't worth anywhere near the price tag demanded. The game is nowhere near ready; IMO Steam shouldn't even allow this to be classified as early access, as it is just in the conceptual stage and not even alpha. What doesn't help is that the Steam store page hides this fact behind a "read more" button, which lulls people into thinking that the game is even remotely in a good enough state for even a partial release. Not to mention that the "normal" difficulty level is so extremely high, which generally mean that you will blast past the maximum 2 hours for a refund. My advice? Go and download the demo, as the full early access "campaign" literally contains just one more map than the demo. Do NOT buy this game in its current state.

I really enjoy games like this. The light attitude simple but good graphics. By the way the campaign start video is hilarious! I started tutorial then quit part way through its pretty easy. Basically if you have navigated most RTS or strategy games this will be familiar. Seems like developers are very involved. Look forward to seeing it grow.
the game is too hard

A year later after my first negative review, and this game is awesome. 100% give it a go.

The game is overall fun and aesthetically pleasing and pretty straightforward as far as this style of games go. However there are some quality of life issues that I'm honestly having trouble getting past. As far as I know there doesn't seem to be an economy "tab" I can open that shows my net gain/loss. You also can't build structures unless you have the people to staff them.

Only 2 Campaign missions are you for real? At the price you are charging with just endless mode?

I was really looking forward to this game after playing the demo, but as it currently is I cannot recommend it. The first level is great and teaches you the main mechanics of the game. It's challenging but not impossible. But then you play the 2nd level, and the difficulty level spikes up way too drastically. It's not bad to fail a level a few times before you get it right, but because the level layouts are random it's RNG on whether you'll get a good start and also means it's very difficult to plan and learn from each failure. The levels also take just long enough to get to the final wave that when you fail it feels like a huge waste of time. There's also much needed QoL that needs to be added to the game, like a way to find idle units or being able to jump to units/buildings/civs under attack. I really hope this game makes it through EA and comes out a great game. I don't want to write it off yet and it has a lot of charm, just needs some more work.

This game has a simple premise. You have told hold off waves of enemies. In order to do so, you need to produce enough soldiers and fortifications. Which requires a robust economy. Your starting resources are used up VERY quickly, and you need to constantly expand into adjacent areas to to get more resources. Nearby areas are infested with enemies that you need to fight and clear out. As you expand your footprint, you also need to expand your defenses to protect your resource production. I think the game is currently a little under-balanced in that there is too little wood in each tree. Should make them last longer. If you've played Age of Empires, this game saves you a lot of micro for workers; you just need to build a building and workers will automatically harvest nearby resources.
this game is grand fun so far!
amazing game
Been looking for this kind of game for a while now. A great mix of survival and RTS, overall fun gameplay but there is still room for growth.

This game is incredibly fun with a captivating and re-playable campaign. The horde dynamics and game difficulty are welcome but take time to get better with. There is a strong learning curve but the game plays fantastic.

Almost ready but cant recommend yet especially for the price tag. This game is a lot of fun at first but loses its oomph as time goes on. On endless the difficulty just isnt fun.. the balance becomes very stupid and very hard. And to top it off the resources are so minimal... If you manage to make it a far ahead, the game punishes you in the worst way... throw a million enemies at me and lose that way, i dont care but good god at least let me prepare for the next wave. This isnt cod zombies, we need time to prepare for the waves considering theres alot of enemies and alot to build and rebuild. The waves come so close together that by the time you beat the wave, the next one is coming in less than a few minutes.... no time to build back up and try to advance your base. It doesnt help that things cost too much so advancing fast is a no go....sometimes you are at the mercy of map design tho. If things cost less for building, then the fast waves wouldnt be a problem. I get its endless and eventually youll die but the way the game is implemented for waves and building cost is just not fun at all, youll have no chance and itll make the last few hours feel pointless. If the next wave counter started when the last wave was killed then it would be alot more fun with the resource costs we face. This game has alot of potential and early game is quite fun but it just needs some tweaks.. ill for sure follow the updates as after all, its still in early access.
a mix of they are billions and stronghold , its amazing , be warned the game is brutal though!

Defending against medieval hordes using a mix of muscle and magic, what’s not to love?... well, the fact that this game is nowhere near ready. I love the concept but the game has very little content even for an early access price tag. Maybe I’ve been soiled by games that are highly developed at the point of release but I’ve completed the games content on day 2. Each round works the same so you just build up and take on waves of enemies. I do think this will be a great game but not worth it right now.
It's got that easy to start, hard to master thing going on. Try the demo and see what you think

Mix between city builder and rts. Game is truly incomplete, poorly balanced. Still though, thumbs up. In the endless mode, you eventually reach a point where you are completely mined out and have to 100% depend on the market for stone and iron (and you can only get 100/50 every 30s).
presents a challenge even on the easiest difficulty., great animations and concept, waiting for the full campaign ♥

I cant get this to work. Ive uninstalled and reinstalled 100 times, verified game cache. The demo ran fine no issues at all. I cant get past the main menu without the screen just freezing up. I cant even report a bug from the game because the button isnt working. I can select the option to go to the next screen (like new game) and nothing happens. If i minimize and bring it back up it will show the next screen but its still frozen. I was told i may need to upgrade but the demo ran fine no issues and i have plenty of other games that require more than this and i have no trouble. Having a lot of fun with this game. There are some issues but while the game is in Early Access, luckily most of the game so far feels polished. There's only two campaign missions right now but they are fun and the cut-scenes have some decent humor. After that you have to play endless mode which is where most of my time is right now. It's good for a good chunk of fun time but there are some issues that come up. Difficulty scaling is the biggest issue in my opinion. The lowest difficulty is okay but feels slightly too easy. So your first reaction is to go to the medium difficulty and maybe that'll be perfect right? Wrong. The medium difficulty is easily 3x+ as hard as the lower one and personally is quite unfun to me. And if you get a mediocre map on top of that just call it quits and restart. There needs to be a balance on the medium difficulty for endless or a 4th difficulty option set between the two. Late game when the screen starts to flood with enemies the game will lag and stutter especially if you zoom out, and if you use the fast forward mods you are likely to crash. Not a hardware issue just an optimization issue with that many enemies. However before you get to that absurd point the game does run amazing to me. There are some bugs such as the game not leaving the grid/build mode unless you open it again and place or left click on an object, but otherwise nothing that's more than even a slight inconvenience. At $25 the game in it's current state may be slightly over priced, but I have thoroughly enjoyed my time so far. If you're a major fan of this genre or catch it on sale I'd say grab it. I'm looking forward to see where the game goes from here.
great game but a bit buggy

Finished the tutorial and there's one simple reason I won't continue. Unoptimized and buggy. I experience regular freezes (not a performance issue as the game runs totally smoothly except for the freezes), and the intro movie to the first campaign mission won't even show (just a completely black screen with some sounds). Edit: did the first mission, outtro movie won't play either. Movies just seem broken.
gg

Love it. Satisfyingly challenging with great progression as your settlement is improved. An overarching sense of claustrophobia from both the nearby enemy camps and the need to build compactly to make sure that you can consolidate your defence forces for the final attack. This is different to other settlement building games where extensively sprawling out is a requirement to becoming strong. That being said, you will need to dip your toes into the wilderness as you deplete resources nearby. This makes it all the more tense and exciting. The developers may need to make tweaks to the difficulty settings if they want to facilitate players that want an easy ride, but I personally love the challenge. Some waves that show up make me think 'Are you serious!?' but I like being kept on my toes. The narrative at the start of each campaign mission is amusing and a bit weird, and could do with speeding up at times, but shows promise for some wild & silly stories as they add more missions. I look forward to more types of buildings being added, although this might mean we need to expand the map and push out the enemy camps a bit further to allow for more expansive settlements. Can't wait to see where this game goes!

Some good considerations: - Very fun to build your city, arm massive towers with trebuchets and archers. - Wave system keeps tension high and its a constant struggle to replenish your resources as resource nodes can run out. - Aesthetics are nice - Somewhat nice variety in units, archers, swordsman, catapults, horseman etc Some bad considerations: - Some UI elements are very bad, especially the notification system when some of your buildings are attacked - Low on content, only 2 campaign missions and an endless mode(which is fun). - Map generation is kinda bad, since you can get a map which has considerably bad choke points and resources. - Some people are reporting performance trouble in later waves with large amounts of enemies, I haven't personally noticed this.
goooood :)
Very fun game love the endless mode. Only problem is it crash's a lot! But i would still recommend, hopefully they get the crash bug worked out.
At this time no. "Git Gud" on easy setting is too much. I'm considering to use other methods just to play this game.
fun peasants not happy
A fun game, similar to They are billions but with a medieval fantasy setting. The campaign needs to be expanded but the sandbox mode is quite enjoyable.

I agree with one of the other reviews, this just isn't ready yet. The Procedural Generation is the most frustrating part to me, you can start a mission and it is literally impossible to win based on the resources provided. The UI is also super annoying, feels almost like a mobile game.

I got this game without realizing it was early access. After beating the second mission in the campaign it was "over". So that part sucked. With that being said I had a great time playing the two missions currently in the campaign. I played on the middle difficulty and god bless was it harder than i thought it would be. It got to a point where i thought it might be impossible to beat but I found a way. It was that challenge that made this game fun even with only two missions at the moment. Seeing how big the campaign map is it looks really promising and the release cant come soon enough. Hopefully the endless mode will tide me over until then.
Automated Market Pls !!! I urgently need a convenient way to get stone and iron in endless mode.

Game is not balanced enough yet. I had 6 Berry picker huts and 5 fisherman's huts, plus an granary. Also had plenty of people working, in a healthy condition. Every minute I hear, oh the people are starving. It is obliviously annoying to listen to and should not be a priority when you are 30 minutes in. Oh and I wasn't able to build a stone cutter until the first 20 minutes because it was out of my town's range, effectively stopping you from building a granary in time, in a game in which time is essential as waves of enemies come non-stop.

One of the best recent indie games, with great foundation for early access. In essence this game is a siege survival simulator with thousands of units under your banner. awesome game, can't complain its EA only had one CTD so far. it just needs Multiplayer, co-op, VS and survival would be amazing, co-op survival choosing to work together against the hoard or fighting on two fronts lets see.

The game already is a lot of fun! I am looking foreward to further updates, especially to using more different buildings/mechanics. It would be great if there could be some sort of overview to how many resources are being produced on a daily basis and improvements in how the AI behaves.

Great game for early access. I'm excited to see what the future holds for the game. Very addictive. I would like some more options regarding diplomacy tho. Perhaps options like never, no way or inconceivable.

very scary :(

I usually don't like this play style for games but this won me over. It's an incredibly challenging and mostly fast paced game that requires lots of strategy. The game however is far too hard, even on easy mode. There is little to no room for error and success is pretty much just based on the rng of map generation. Some maps suck and you get screwed. Some are amazing and the game is easy. If you want an easier game, you should probably wait a few months until full release when they add even easier game mode. While there are many problems, mostly with difficulty, for a game that only came out a few days ago as of now is amazing. I highly recommend the game to people willing to take a challenge. There are a few game breaking bugs when it comes to waves but the game auto saves enough that it's never a problem. Worth it for the price. Edit: Game has become far more playable and is actually just perfect. Nearly all bugs are gone and has much content. Now with endless supply, rng is no longer a problem. Still quite hard but just the right amount. (It's probably just that I'm terrible at RTS games.) 10/10

Not worth your money yet. It's almost full price for early access and the UI and difficulty scaling is horrible. There isn't an enjoyable build of this game at the moment. The AI is terrible for the uses you would need in this game. Why a single person can be attacking your buildings and your military is right next to them doing nothing. The first two waves are fine and by the time the third comes in you haven't had enough time. I get you're trying to make the game difficult, but the scaling is way off for almost full price. I wouldn't buy this just yet, It's like every system is 80% done and that last 20% is what you need or want to really enjoy this game. it has potential but not in it's current stage. You would have more fun playing something like "Going Medieval" to kill time. It's not meant to be difficult like this game but the build out is better thought out.

20+ hours in and I can safely say I'm really enjoying it, and already got my monies worth. Very similar to They Are Billions, however I would actually say I enjoy this game more. With TAB I would get so demoralized after a loss, it felt like time wasted and I'd want to play something else. With this I simply want to jump right back in to try to do better. I will say a lot of your success feels like RNG, since the maps are procedurally generated you'll feel like your getting steam rolled 2 or 3 times before you get your footing or get a good map with a lot choke points. It's also still in very Early Access, I was disappointed to see the big beautiful campaign map only to realize only 2 missions are currently available. However the endless mode has kept me plenty preoccupied, and I look forward to seeing where the game goes from here. EDIT: It has now been just over 2 years since I posted this review, and while I have enjoyed my time with the game and the dev's have worked hard to continue to improve and refine the horde modes and game play loop, I can't help but admit I become extremely dissapointed with the lack of any (playable) progress on the campaign. The dev's have been saying continually that they just need more time, and they don't want to release it until its ready, but then why did the game launch with the first 2 missions if the plan was to wait until the entire campaign was done to release anything else? I will still keep my review positive, but at this time I would say buy it if you're okay with different horde-mode repayable matches. DO NOT BUY THIS FOR THE PROMISE OF A CAMPAIGN. Buy it for what it is and you'll be happy, but I do not have faith in the devs to deliver any campaign for the foreseeable future.

This game not meant for casual players, they provide very little resources and time to be able to efficiently prepare for an attack. The ai that is sent to kill you will be in huge groups and only grow in size and if they destroy any buildings or kill people it causes big problems even on easy mode essentially allowing little margin of error if not any at all. If the game had difficultly settings to allow you to fine tune them to your liking it would be 10x better already. The game provokes you to spam soldiers asap leaving you with slow resource income for better and stronger buildings/defences in the long run unless you spam houses which will only cause food issues. Resources are finite so your forced to expand leaving some areas undefended while you prepare. Id say the game is focused towards players who enjoy fast paced rushed game play with an already set game plan in mind. The game is still fun but dying 8/10 times is only fun for so long

OK, this recommendation is a yes but only in terms of, is it worth playing. Not value for money. It's absolutely not worth 25 bucks at the moment. Very early days but I like it. It's like Stronghold meets They Are Billions, which is interesting. The art style isn't bad, the gameplay is pretty straightforward (build an economy, build walls and troops, survive waves of enemies) but rewards good play and brutally punishes bad play. Right now there's two campaign levels, although I imagine we'll see more rapidly. The difficulty is tuned fairly high; when you make mistakes you'll suffer. At the same time, I was able to recover from fairly disastrous waves quickly without a cascade of failures which isn't the case in many similar games. Like I said, at the moment it is absolutely 100% not worth paying 25 dollars for, at all. Like I said, two campaign levels. That said I think there's real potential and I'll play it again in a few months, so I don't regret buying it.

A decent horde defense game. Never played they are billions, but I have grown up playing a lot of RTS games. -The pacing of the game is very well done, with the player being incentivized to spend a fair amount of time on each town hall level to build up economy and defenses. Each level has meaningful jumps in power and production if you take the time to invest in them -The unit variety is decent for a game like this, and I can say every unit makes sense at some point in the game. -Economy looks simple on the surface, but actually has a bit of depth. Between the productivity boosting buildings you get late in the game, and location of storages to minimize travel time, to upgrading structures, there is a lot going on here. -Simplistic magic system. Four spells, you unlock more as you upgrade a certain structure. Each has a use, but I wish there was more to it. -Very clever upgrade mechanic, with useful upgrades that boost just about every aspect of you ability to build and defend. -Clever city management mechanics, albeit at a very surface level. I think this is the weaker part of the game, with the disease/grave mechanic being easily ignorable if you play well enough. -Humor in the campaign got me more than once. Very dry, I love it. -Enemy variety is fairly basic, but oh dear is there a lot of em. -Good pacing in terms of the map. You have to build an offensive part of your army, because so much is gated on going out and killing rebel camps/buildings. The campaign is very short, and a lot of mechanics still need a bit of work, but overall, I think this is very promising, and the devs are VERY receptive to feedback. There was a small difficulty balance patch on day one or two, so seems very good on that front. I think the devs have what it takes to make this a great game, and I am willing to invest a bit more based on how promising the demo and game are now. If you don't think so, wait for a sale. I, however, very much enjoy it now, and wholeheartedly recommend it.

There's plenty of map to explore, resources close to your starting position and a decent selection of buildings technologies and units. The graphics are very basic. Building placement is fiddly and there's a lot of micro decisions to make. What destroys the game is the combat system. Its hard to handle armies, you are attacked by large forces from all points of the Empire and you just get swamped. There's a lot of busy work and very little fun.

This is basically "RTS mechanics 101" with appealing presentation value and a nice sense of the frantics. It's not subtle. The frantics come from assault waves you have to prepare for and the idiocy of your troops, you have to learn how much of everything is enough and what sorts of idiocy you have to prevent, and how. See? RTS mechanics 101. There's one formation (you can scroll between a longer and shorter battle line) and no troop discipline to speak of at all; infantry are simply incapable of forming a line if they can see the enemy. As RTS puzzles go it's not a challenge. There's memorizing how much you'll need to build to meet wave number N (since there's no scouting the main enemy, they just arrive from off-map), figuring out how to build that much that fast (that's a genuine challenge in this game, even on the "easy" setting finding time to build and man enough walls for the 2nd, 3rd, 4th waves is not easy), and micromanaging the slaughter of the charging-straight-in horde.

What the heck? My keep gets repeatedly attacked for absolutely no reason. The villagers in this game are completely unreasonable, I needed their food and resources to make my keep larger, taking it was justified. Seriously, this is really good. Mechanics are straight forward but well done. The bread and butter of the game are the huge, organic enemy armies. Blasting them is very satisfying. Edit (after playing part of the campaign): It's worth being aware of the difficulty. The campaign missions ramp up a lot. You may need to play some survival mode to build up your skills for some of those. And even survival mode, the max difficulty setting are very hard. Be prepared to pause a lot to fight multiple battles at a time, re-load to earlier points, and still lose even with those. That said, this type of game needs an ultra-high difficulty setting or some players will be bored.
